Description: Hello. Here is an early 1991 Paul Reed Smith CE 24. Built in the first factory with all the desirable components. Highly Quilted Maple top, Whale Blue faded to a turquoise greenish color. Alder back.Wide thin neck with short/small heel. Maybe Brazilian finger board? Frets are in excellent condition , with only slight string wear/ Frets were polished, and board was treated with linseed oil. Low action, fast, smooth, and super easy to play! Small PRS logo on head stock, Schaller Germany made wing locking tuners. PRS Unobtanium nut. Super tight neck joint with no stress cracks. NOTE: Pics. taken with an LG Phone. Not the best HD quality. Finish has some normal handling wear for a guitar this age. Some scuffs, some marrs, and swirls. The worst being 2 finger nail sized indents on the back (pic.# 10) Overall super Clean, and she Polished up superbly with Virtuoso polish. The highly desired One piece Mann made Mil -Com Tremolo with No wear at all. Looks Mint. The original 5 way wafer rotary switch. and the original PRS treble bleed circuit. The HFS was swapped out for a David Grissom Bridge. Pick up alone costs $275.00. The Original White Label Vintage Bass pick up in the neck. ( do not have the HFS ) Awesome tone, and tremendous control of your tone with the circuit, and the 5 way switch. PRS OHSC in excellent cond. Tremolo arm in case with some paperwork. No spec. card. Open to best offers, but somewhat firm as this is a rare , adult owned, and well kept piece of PRS History. I will cover full insurance on the guitar when shipping to you via Fed Ex. Thank you
Title: Paul Reed Smith 1991 CE 24 Quilted Faded Whale Blue Maple Top OHSC EXcellent
